title: Post-concussion syndrome
summary: Post-concussion syndrome (PCS) is a set of symptoms that may continue for weeks, months, or a year or more after a concussion – a mild traumatic brain injury (TBI).[1][2][3] About 15-30% of people with concussion develop persistent or prolonged symptoms associated with the injury. Prolonged concussion is defined as having concussion symptoms for over 4-weeks following the first accident in youth and for weeks or months in adults.[4]
